item.title: Barred from grocery stores by facial recognition
item.description: British merchants are increasingly using the technology to combat shoplifting, raising questions about its spread as artificial intelligence rapidly improves it.

item.title: Amazon shuts down customer’s smart home devices after delivery driver’s false racism claim
item.description: Amazon shut off a man’s smart home devices for a week after a delivery driver falsely accused the customer of hurling a racial slur via a doorbell intercom, the tech giant confirmed Thursday.

item.title: West Darfur governor abducted, killed as war in Sudan spreads
item.description: West Darfur state governor Khamis Abakar killed after TV interview accusing paramilitary fighters of killing civilians in large numbers and calling for international intervention.

item.title: Scientists say first synthetic human "embryo" created
item.description: Research says embryo-like structures will lack organs such as a beating heart or a brain, but include cells that would typically go on to form the placenta, yolk sac and the embryo itself.

item.title: Facial recognition finds alleged Bosnian war criminal hiding in Tennessee, DHS claims
item.description: Bosnia and Herzegovina is still searching for war criminals from the Bosnian War. One has been living a quiet life in Tennessee, according to the DHS, which arrested him this month.

item.title: For the sixth year, Algeria blocks internet nationwide to prevent cheating during final exams
item.description: This is the sixth year Algeria decides to block the internet, and their senior officials, say, unfortunately, other solutions do not work.

item.title: An electric cruise ship with gigantic sails is set to launch in 2030
item.description: Adventure cruise company Hurtigruten Norway today revealed plans for a zero-emissions electric cruise ship with retractable sails covered in solar panels, which is due to set sail in 2030

item.title: FBI PSA: Malicious actors manipulating photos and videos to create explicit content and sextortion schemes
item.description: The FBI is warning the public of malicious actors creating synthetic content (commonly referred to as "deepfakes") by manipulating benign photographs or videos to target victims.

item.title: Paralyzed man walks naturally, thanks to wireless ‘bridge’ between brain and spine
item.description: Implanted brain electrodes send signals that bypass damaged spinal cord area, using man’s thoughts to stimulate leg movement

item.title: India first democracy to ban encrypted messaging apps on massive scale
item.description: Only days before Press Freedom Day, India banned apps for secure communication because of "terrorists" use.
